biotools.summary:
The Exposome Maps contain geospatially resolved data on environmental exposures (Exposome Surfaces), categorized into the following Exposome dimensions:
Built Environment28 exposures related to:
•	Green space
•	Blue space
•	Grey space
Food Environment4 exposures related to:
•	Food landscape / healthy food index
Physico-Chemical Environment99 exposures related to:
•	Air pollution
•	Biodiversity
•	Weather conditions
•	Light intensity at night
•	Noise
•	Pesticides
•	Electromagnetic fields
Social Environment70 exposures related to:
•	Neighbourhood socio-economic position
•	Neighbourhood Demographic surfaces and population characteristics
•	Social capital
•	Security
•	Mental health
•	Proximity to facilities
•	Energy use
•	Labour market
